item.title: 2 x trailers, 23rd June
item.description:
There is an issue with trailers with no cabs attached being left in this part of Hailey Road for extended periods of time. The cabs disappear to collect other trailers from elsewhere and only come back for the ones that are parked in Hailey Road when they need them. This causes much inconvenience for the residents of the business properties as what should be their daily parking is being used buy transport companies that are aiming to avoid incurring extra parking costs. There is an actual lorry/trailer park in Hailey Road that they could use. This trailer issue seems to be getting more of an issue as a local chinese food manufacturer that is local expands.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hailey Road, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Powdery white block clogging tiny bin could be asbestos, 23rd June
item.description:
There's a substance blocking the bin outside school. Lots of white particles flying off it. I tried to push further into bin and it would not go down. It was flytipped. I'm concerned it could bei asbestos? It was not polystyrene. Also general litter thrown near bin. It is too small as I E already said so please provide larger bin.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Page Heath Lane, Bickley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped paint cans, 23rd June
item.description:
Several bags of paint cans have been fly tipped on Wingfield Street near the corner of Maxted Road. This is a frequent fly tipping location, so I would appreciate if this could be resolved quickly so that it doesn’t attract more rubbish. I previously reported this issue, and it was marked as “fixed,” but the paint cans are still there. Thank you!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Wingfield Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Boxes, polystyrene, bags of rubbish, 23rd June
item.description:
This has been here for over a couple of weeks now. The bin services are not taking it. The streets look terrible and random people continue to add to the rubbish and its becoming a dumping ground. Please can it be arranged to be taken. Its not on private land its on the pavements by the road. It does not belong to surrounding neighbours and has been dumped anonymously.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 246,248, The Vista, Middle Park, London

item.title: Update basketball posts shacklewell basketball court, 23rd June
item.description:
I am reaching out on behalf of the basketball community using the Shacklewell Street basketball court. The court surface and paint job are great and well above average considering the standard for basketball courts in London. However the current basketball posts unfortunately don’t match the same standard, the community has often complained about the lack of nets and the poor quality of backboards. Making the ball bounce in uncontrolled directions, and leaving the court area too often, disrupting the quality of practice. Additionally the lack of padding around the posts, creates risk of injuries, several players have hit the unpadded metal pole and have suffered bruises from it. I’m asking if it would be possible to update the basketball posts to ones that match the professional outdoor court standards. Strong glass backboard with heavy duty flex rings are standard features for more “proper” courts, they are used in Finsbury Park and the recently refurbished Ducketts Commons courts. For exemple this: https://www.networldsports.co.uk/forza-adjustable-basketball-unit-in-ground.html+pole_padding_size-No?gad_source=1&gad_campaignid=14627876124&gbraid=0AAAAADn0RBkrdqXsTzE99nwR2gS47YHsq This would be great for the local basketball community, and would set an exemple in the current effort to drive investment in refurbishing basketball courts in the UK. Look forward to hearing back from the appropriate representatives soon on this.
Report on FixMyStreet
